FUNCTION.NAME: MS_DMS_CHK_OUTOFOFFICE_USER
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE:
Returns the count of the users for out of office users for the input value user id
Method used in multiple procedures, views,infolet, package example MS_DMS_PROCESS_SV
If the user has an outof office, check for the out of office user validity if the out of office user is valid return the userid else return 0
else if the user does not have outof office enabled, check if the user has end date if the user has end date then return 0, else return user_id
FUNCTION.COMMENT:
Returns the count of the users for out of office users for the input value user id
Method used in multiple procedures, views,infolet, package example MS_DMS_PROCESS_SV
If the user has an outof office, check for the out of office user validity if the out of office user is valid return the userid else return 0
else if the user does not have outof office enabled, check if the user has end date if the user has end date then return 0, else return user_id

ARGUMENT.NAME: I_USER_ID
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: -- Number type provides the info about user id value

RETURN.COMMENT:
Count --Possible value for return type is number value for the count of users
ERROR indicating unexpected errors in Ms_Dms_User_List evaluation

TAG.COMMENT: i_user_id -- Number type provides the info about user id value

Count --Possible value for return type is number value for the count of users

Module: MS_DMS_COMMON_HOOK
Description: Methods in this package are used for Attachment based document flow generation
Package is called when a Normal document form is submitted for creation or upversion ======================================================================

PACKAGE.NAME: MS_DMS_DIST_ADMIN_HELPER
PACKAGE.COMMENT:
======================================================================
Module: MS_DMS_DIST_ADMIN_HELPER
Description: This package calls call_etl. ETL Procedure, responsible to load the MS tables with the data got from Process Designer DS. ETL procedure created by the ETL Engine of APP BUILDER. The procedure takes care of loading the data that is sent by the FLOW BUILDER and store the same in MS TABLES. Data is already processed and stored accordingly in the iop_data object structure. The object can have one or more records. The ETL is designed to take care of one or more records. ======================================================================

PACKAGE.NAME: MS_DMS_ERR_LOGS_PKG
PACKAGE.COMMENT:
======================================================================
Module: MS_DMS_ERR_LOGS_PKG
Description: Package is used for logging error and debug messages from the system
All the messages will be inserted into MS_DMS_ERR_LOGS table Values populated to tables are MS_DMS_DOC_AUDIT_HISTORY, MS_DMS_DOCUMENTS_HDR, MS_DMS_DOCUMENTS etc ======================================================================

VARIABLE.NAME: GN_LOG_LEVEL
VARIABLE.COMMENT: Variables

PROCEDURE.NAME: INSERT_LOG
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: INSERT_LOG method is used for inserting messages to the MS_DMS_ERR_LOGS table
PROCEDURE.COMMENT: INSERT_LOG method is used for inserting messages to the MS_DMS_ERR_LOGS table

ARGUMENT.NAME: PN_ERROR_HANDLE_ID
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: This will be the numerical value and it will same for one transcation or one single flow

ARGUMENT.NAME: PN_ERROR_SEQUENCE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Numerical value generated by sequence for every log into MS_DMS_ERR_LOGS table

ARGUMENT.NAME: PD_ERROR_TIME
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Captures the error time for the debug and error messages

ARGUMENT.NAME: PC_ERROR_TEXT
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Text captured while logging error and debug messages

THROWS.NAME: OTHERS
THROWS.COMMENT: If there is any Error then storing the error details in MS_DMS_ERR_LOGS table.

TAG.COMMENT: PN_ERROR_HANDLE_ID This will be the numerical value and it will same for one transcation or one single flow
pn_error_sequence Numerical value generated by sequence for every log into MS_DMS_ERR_LOGS table
pd_error_time Captures the error time for the debug and error messages
pc_error_type Captures the string like 'e', 'E', 'DMSLOG'
pc_error_text Text captured while logging error and debug messages
pn_pid Process_Instance_id of the submitted form
OTHERS If there is any Error then storing the error details in MS_DMS_ERR_LOGS table.

PROCEDURE.NAME: CREATE_ATTRIBUTES
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE:
Procedure alters the table MS_DMS_DOC_EXTENDED_ATTRIBS,MS_DMS_CONFIG_DOC_TAB to add columns.
Drops all the domain indexes and recreate it at the end.
Send assignment for stage user list or DMS review document push form based on the condition.

Review type. Possible value are:

ERROR indicating unexpected errors in review type evaluation

ip_stage_code not used

FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: A subset of the input user ids are returned.

A subset of the input user ids are returned. Subset is identified based on following conditions:

FUNCTION.NAME: MS_DMS_VALIDATE_USER
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Validate a single user.
FUNCTION.COMMENT: Validate a single user. Input can be either login name or user id

ARGUMENT.NAME: X_USER_NAME
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: login name of the user to be validated. Either login name or user id is mandatory

ARGUMENT.NAME: X_USER_ID
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: user id of the user to be validated. Either login name or user id is mandatory

RETURN.COMMENT:
one of the following:
login name when input is user id
user id when input is login name
0 when no user is present with the given user id or login name

TAG.COMMENT: x_user_name login name of the user to be validated. Either login name or user id is mandatory
x_user_id user id of the user to be validated. Either login name or user id is mandatory

one of the following:
login name when input is user id
user id when input is login name
0 when no user is present with the given user id or login name

FUNCTION.NAME: MS_DMS_REMOVE_OOF_USERS
FUNCTION.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: A subset of the input user ids are returned.
FUNCTION.COMMENT:
A subset of the input user ids are returned. Subset is identified based on following conditions:
1. Assigned to users of out of office users are removed from the input
2. If the assigned to user is same for more than one out of office users, then all out off office users except the first are removed from the input

RETURN.COMMENT: subset of input user id

======================================================================
Module: MS_DMS_FUTURE_EFF_DATE_POLICY
Description: This Package is being Used to generate the Policy Assignment for the Ready for Production Document. This is based on Scheduled Infolet. The Infolet will run at 10.30 PM everyday and will pick the document which are in Ready for Production state and will move to prodution next day
======================================================================

======================================================================

PROCEDURE.NAME: PROCESS_DOCUMENT_REVIEW
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Flow Logic: 1.Get all the push form infolet ids 2.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_hdr table Here it is checking whether the document submition is valid or not.
PROCEDURE.COMMENT:
Flow Logic: 1.Get all the push form infolet ids 2.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_hdr table Here it is checking whether the document submition is valid or not. if not it will exit the program 3.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_stage_dtl table 4.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_stage_usr_dtl table 5.Get the record from the DMS Review push form. 6.update all Common attributes like a.document_attachment b.comments_log sub procedure used : update_common_attributes 7.if the document owner is doing a continue working 1.He may lock and unlock the document while doing continue working sub procedure used: process_continue_working 8.if one of the user is submiting the form (Moving to next level) then 1.current_process_status in ms_dms_documents_stage_usr_dtl set to 'Y' 2.check type of approval required to move the stage 3.version number generation for each submit 4.update the latest version number in ms_dms_documents_hdr table (get the latest from ms_dms_documents_hdr table) 5.Check whether Creating new assignments for the new stage depend on the approval type 6.If it is yes then delete any existing assignments for DMS Review form. 7.create assignments for new stages 8.update the ms_dms_documents_hdr table for the following columns a.current_stage_seq b.current_stage_id c.current_stage_name d.version_number
Approval Process can be All Any Owner Non Owner - Any Non Owner - All
sub procedure used : process_doc_move_stage 9.if user is set to prev level then 1.Calculate the previous seq number 2.Create all assingnments for the previous level 3.Update the ms_dms_documents_hdr for following columns a.current_stage_seq b.current_stage_id c.current_stage_name d.version_number 4.update the ms_dms_documents_stage_dtl table for current_stage_flag set to 'Y' for current level 5.update the ms_dms_documents_stage_usr_dtl table for current_process_status set to 'Y' for current level users and update all the assignments. sub procedure used : process_doc_move_stage
10.if the user terminate the document process then

PROCEDURE.NAME: PRODUCTION_EMAIL
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: FUNCTION author_publish_assign(IP_FLOW_CODE IN VARCHAR2, IP_STAGE_CODE IN VARCHAR2, IP_PID IN NUMBER, ip_id in number) RETURN CLOB AS L_USERNAME_LIST CLOB; X_LENGTH NUMBER; X_ERR VARCHAR2(4000); CURSOR V_USERS IS SELECT DISTINCT L1_APPROVER_SEC "USERS" FROM MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUN_V WHERE PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID = IP_PID AND MULTIROW_REGION_ID = MS_DMS_FLOW_UTILITIES.GET_MULTIROW_ID('MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUNENT', 'SEC') AND instance_id = (SELECT MAX(instance_id) from MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUN_V where process_instance_id = ip_pid) AND review_response_sec <> 'NRP' UNION SELECT DISTINCT L1_APPROVER_SUB "USERS" FROM MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUN_V WHERE PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID = IP_PID AND MULTIROW_REGION_ID = MS_DMS_FLOW_UTILITIES.GET_MULTIROW_ID('MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUNENT', 'SUB') AND instance_id = (SELECT MAX(instance_id) from MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUN_V where process_instance_id = ip_pid) AND review_response_sec <> 'NRP' UNION SELECT DISTINCT L2_APPROVER_SEC "USERS" FROM MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUN_V WHERE PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID = IP_PID AND MULTIROW_REGION_ID = MS_DMS_FLOW_UTILITIES.GET_MULTIROW_ID('MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUNENT', 'SEC') AND instance_id = (SELECT MAX(instance_id) from MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUN_V WHERE process_instance_id = IP_PID) and upper(requires_approval_from_sec) = '2' AND review_response_sec <> 'NRP' UNION SELECT DISTINCT L2_APPROVER_SUB "USERS" FROM MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUN_V WHERE PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID = IP_PID AND MULTIROW_REGION_ID = MS_DMS_FLOW_UTILITIES.GET_MULTIROW_ID('MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUNENT', 'SUB') AND instance_id = (SELECT MAX(instance_id) from MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUN_V WHERE process_instance_id = IP_PID) and upper(requires_approval_from_sub) = '2' AND review_response_sec <> 'NRP' UNION SELECT DISTINCT L3_APPROVER_SEC "USERS" FROM MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUN_V WHERE PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID = IP_PID AND MULTIROW_REGION_ID = MS_DMS_FLOW_UTILITIES.GET_MULTIROW_ID('MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUNENT', 'SEC') AND instance_id = (SELECT MAX(instance_id) from MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUN_V WHERE process_instance_id = IP_PID) and upper(requires_approval_from_sec) = '2' AND review_response_sec <> 'NRP' UNION SELECT DISTINCT L2_APPROVER_SUB "USERS" FROM MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUN_V WHERE PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID = IP_PID AND MULTIROW_REGION_ID = MS_DMS_FLOW_UTILITIES.GET_MULTIROW_ID('MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUNENT', 'SUB') AND instance_id = (SELECT MAX(instance_id) from MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUN_V WHERE process_instance_id = IP_PID) and upper(requires_approval_from_sub) = '2' AND review_response_sec <> 'NRP'; BEGIN FOR I IN V_USERS LOOP IF I.USERS IS NOT NULL THEN L_USERNAME_LIST := L_USERNAME_LIST || ',' || I.USERS; END IF; END LOOP; x_LENGTH := dbms_lob.getlength(L_USERNAME_LIST); L_USERNAME_LIST := DBMS_LOB.SUBSTR(L_USERNAME_LIST, X_LENGTH, 2); RETURN L_USERNAME_LIST; EXCEPTION WHEN OTHERS THEN return null; END author_publish_assign;

MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUN_V WHERE process_instance_id = IP_PID) and upper(requires_approval_from_sec) = '2' AND review_response_sec <> 'NRP' UNION SELECT DISTINCT L2_APPROVER_SUB "USERS" FROM MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUN_V WHERE PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID = IP_PID AND MULTIROW_REGION_ID = MS_DMS_FLOW_UTILITIES.GET_MULTIROW_ID('MS_DMS_INLINE_CREATE_DOCMUNENT', 'SUB') AND instance_id = (SELECT I.USERS IS NOT NULL THEN L_USERNAME_LIST := L_USERNAME_LIST || ',' || I.USERS; END IF; END LOOP; x_LENGTH := dbms_lob.getlength(L_USERNAME_LIST); L_USERNAME_LIST := DBMS_LOB.SUBSTR(L_USERNAME_LIST, X_LENGTH, 2); RETURN L_USERNAME_LIST; EXCEPTION WHEN OTHERS THEN return null; END author_publish_assign;

ip_id instance id
confirmation. Possible values are: PUBLISH indicating ready to publish DONT_PUBLISH indicating not ready to publish

FUNCTION.NAME: CONTINUE_REVIEW_IN_STAGE

FUNCTION.COMMENT: Confirm if a document, identified by process instance id and instance id, should continue in review stage or not.

ARGUMENT.NAME: IP_PID
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: process instance id of the document

RETURN.COMMENT:
confirmation. Possible value are:
CANCEL indicating the confirmation to move to cancel stage
CONTINUE indicating the confirmation to continue in review stage
PUBLISH indicating the confirmation to move to publish stage
Absence of value(NULL) indicating an unexpected error

TAG.COMMENT: ip_flow_code not used
ip_stage_code not used
ip_pid process instance id of the document
ip_id instance id of the document

confirmation. Possible value are:
CANCEL indicating the confirmation to move to cancel stage
CONTINUE indicating the confirmation to continue in review stage
PUBLISH indicating the confirmation to move to publish stage
Absence of value(NULL) indicating an unexpected error

PROCEDURE.NAME: LOCK_ENTRY

PROCEDURE.COMMENT: -------------------------------------------------------------------------- LOCK_ENTRY : Procedure to lock the object in order to stop any other transitions happening on the same object. This routine will set the DD_EDIT_FLAG to N. ------------------------------------------------------------------------

PROCEDURE.NAME: UNLOCK_ENTRY
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: -------------------------------------------------------------------------- UNLOCK_ENTRY : Procedure to unlock the object in order to allow other transitions on the object.
PROCEDURE.COMMENT: -------------------------------------------------------------------------- UNLOCK_ENTRY : Procedure to unlock the object in order to allow other transitions on the object. This routine will set the DD_EDIT_FLAG to Y. ------------------------------------------------------------------------

x_ret_args3 Out parameter, ,Mail User List value
x_ret_args4 Out parameter, approval requrirement value
x_ret_args5 Out parameter, temporaray value
x_ret_args6 Out parameter, Version number value
x_ret_argsn7 Out parameter, Current stage sequence
x_ret_argsn8 Out parameter, temporaray value
x_ret_argsn9 Out parameter, temporaray value
x_ret_argsn10 Out parameter, temporaray value
X_ERROR_CODE 0 for success non-zero for error
X_ERROR_MESSAGE Error message parameter , in case of exceptions and errors
x_assignment_id Assignment ID of the form

PROCEDURE.NAME: PROCESS_DOCUMENT_REVIEW
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Flow Logic: 1.Get all the push form infolet ids 2.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_hdr table Here it is checking whether the document submition is valid or not.
PROCEDURE.COMMENT:
Flow Logic: 1.Get all the push form infolet ids 2.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_hdr table Here it is checking whether the document submition is valid or not. if not it will exit the program 3.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_stage_dtl table 4.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_stage_usr_dtl table 5.Get the record from the DMS Review push form. 6.update all Common attributes like a.document_attachment b.comments_log sub procedure used : update_common_attributes 7.if the document owner is doing a continue working 1.He may lock and unlock the document while doing continue working sub procedure used: process_continue_working 8.if one of the user is submiting the form (Moving to next level) then 1.current_process_status in ms_dms_documents_stage_usr_dtl set to 'Y' 2.check type of approval required to move the stage 3.version number generation for each submit 4.update the latest version number in ms_dms_documents_hdr table (get the latest from ms_dms_documents_hdr table) 5.Check whether Creating new assignments for the new stage depend on the approval type 6.If it is yes then delete any existing assignments for DMS Review form. 7.create assignments for new stages 8.update the ms_dms_documents_hdr table for the following columns a.current_stage_seq b.current_stage_id c.current_stage_name d.version_number
Approval Process can be All Any Owner Non Owner - Any Non Owner - All
sub procedure used : process_doc_move_stage 9.if user is set to prev level then 1.Calculate the previous seq number 2.Create all assingnments for the previous level 3.Update the ms_dms_documents_hdr for following columns a.current_stage_seq b.current_stage_id c.current_stage_name d.version_number 4.update the ms_dms_documents_stage_dtl table for current_stage_flag set to 'Y' for current level 5.update the ms_dms_documents_stage_usr_dtl table for current_process_status set to 'Y' for current level users and update all the assignments. sub procedure used : process_doc_move_stage
10.if the user terminate the document process then

PROCEDURE.NAME: PROCESS_DOCUMENT_REVIEW

PROCESS_DOCUMENT_REVIEW method is called for document review flow

This method in turns calls the sub programs for insertion into DMS base tables

PROCESS_DOCUMENT_REVIEW method is called for document review flow
This method will handle the operations from reviewer stage to Production
This method in turns calls the sub programs for insertion into DMS base tables

PROCEDURE.NAME: PROCESS_DOCUMENT_REVIEW
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Flow Logic: 1.Get all the push form infolet ids 2.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_hdr table Here it is checking whether the document submition is valid or not.
PROCEDURE.COMMENT:
Flow Logic: 1.Get all the push form infolet ids 2.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_hdr table Here it is checking whether the document submition is valid or not. if not it will exit the program 3.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_stage_dtl table 4.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_stage_usr_dtl table 5.Get the record from the DMS Review push form. 6.update all Common attributes like a.document_attachment b.comments_log sub procedure used : update_common_attributes 7.if the document owner is doing a continue working 1.He may lock and unlock the document while doing continue working sub procedure used: process_continue_working 8.if one of the user is submiting the form (Moving to next level) then 1.current_process_status in ms_dms_documents_stage_usr_dtl set to 'Y' 2.check type of approval required to move the stage 3.version number generation for each submit 4.update the latest version number in ms_dms_documents_hdr table (get the latest from ms_dms_documents_hdr table) 5.Check whether Creating new assignments for the new stage depend on the approval type 6.If it is yes then delete any existing assignments for DMS Review form. 7.create assignments for new stages 8.update the ms_dms_documents_hdr table for the following columns a.current_stage_seq b.current_stage_id c.current_stage_name d.version_number
Approval Process can be All Any Owner Non Owner - Any Non Owner - All
sub procedure used : process_doc_move_stage 9.if user is set to prev level then 1.Calculate the previous seq number 2.Create all assingnments for the previous level 3.Update the ms_dms_documents_hdr for following columns a.current_stage_seq b.current_stage_id c.current_stage_name d.version_number 4.update the ms_dms_documents_stage_dtl table for current_stage_flag set to 'Y' for current level 5.update the ms_dms_documents_stage_usr_dtl table for current_process_status set to 'Y' for current level users and update all the assignments. sub procedure used : process_doc_move_stage
10.if the user terminate the document process then

ARGUMENT.NAME: X_ERROR_MESSAGE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Captures and share the oracle error message as output.

THROWS.NAME: X_APPLICATION_ERROR
THROWS.COMMENT:
Returns back to the application when any of these are captured in the flow. push_form_id_not_found or push_form_process_instance_id_not_found or
life_cycle_id_not_found ordoc_delimitor_not_found or validate_create_doc_error or Apps Infra Tables are not configured for the given Module,ID combination or
generate_doc_number_gen_failure or gen_doc_version_number or convert_cr_to_app_error or process_document_hdr_error or convert_process_doc_hdr_to_dtl or
process_lifecycle_get_details or process_document_stage_dtl_error or process_document_user_stage_error.

THROWS.NAME: OTHERS
THROWS.COMMENT: Populate error details into MS_DMS_ERR_LOGS table.

TAG.COMMENT: x_process_instance_id Process instance Identifier.
x_error_code Captures and share the oracle error code as output.
x_error_message Captures and share the oracle error message as output.

x_application_error Returns back to the application when any of these are captured in the flow. push_form_id_not_found or push_form_process_instance_id_not_found or
life_cycle_id_not_found ordoc_delimitor_not_found or validate_create_doc_error or Apps Infra Tables are not configured for the given Module,ID combination or
generate_doc_number_gen_failure or gen_doc_version_number or convert_cr_to_app_error or process_document_hdr_error or convert_process_doc_hdr_to_dtl or
process_lifecycle_get_details or process_document_stage_dtl_error or process_document_user_stage_error.
OTHERS Populate error details into MS_DMS_ERR_LOGS table.

PROCEDURE.NAME: PROCESS_DOCUMENT_REVIEW
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Flow Logic: 1.Get all the push form infolet ids 2.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_hdr table Here it is checking whether the document submition is valid or not.
PROCEDURE.COMMENT:
Flow Logic: 1.Get all the push form infolet ids 2.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_hdr table Here it is checking whether the document submition is valid or not. if not it will exit the program 3.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_stage_dtl table 4.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_stage_usr_dtl table 5.Get the record from the DMS Review push form. 6.update all Common attributes like a.document_attachment b.comments_log sub procedure used : update_common_attributes 7.if the document owner is doing a continue working 1.He may lock and unlock the document while doing continue working sub procedure used: process_continue_working 8.if one of the user is submiting the form (Moving to next level) then 1.current_process_status in ms_dms_documents_stage_usr_dtl set to 'Y' 2.check type of approval required to move the stage 3.version number generation for each submit 4.update the latest version number in ms_dms_documents_hdr table (get the latest from ms_dms_documents_hdr table) 5.Check whether Creating new assignments for the new stage depend on the approval type 6.If it is yes then delete any existing assignments for DMS Review form. 7.create assignments for new stages 8.update the ms_dms_documents_hdr table for the following columns a.current_stage_seq b.current_stage_id c.current_stage_name d.version_number
Approval Process can be All Any Owner Non Owner - Any Non Owner - All
sub procedure used : process_doc_move_stage 9.if user is set to prev level then 1.Calculate the previous seq number 2.Create all assingnments for the previous level 3.Update the ms_dms_documents_hdr for following columns a.current_stage_seq b.current_stage_id c.current_stage_name d.version_number 4.update the ms_dms_documents_stage_dtl table for current_stage_flag set to 'Y' for current level 5.update the ms_dms_documents_stage_usr_dtl table for current_process_status set to 'Y' for current level users and update all the assignments. sub procedure used : process_doc_move_stage
10.if the user terminate the document process then

PACKAGE.NAME: MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS
PACKAGE.COMMENT:
======================================================================
Module: MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS
Description: This Package Encapsulates All the modules for Document Search
======================================================================
Flow:
1. LANDING_PAGE
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________
|JAVA |====>|MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS.SP_DOCUMENT_HOME|====>|MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS.SP_DMS_QUERY_DRIVER|====>
|MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS.SP_DMS_PROD_DOCS(Invokes Specified Method and this Builds Actual Dynamic String)|
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

2. SEARCH_PAGE
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________
|JAVA Calls|====>|MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS.SP_DMS_SEARCH (Uses Dynamic String To Fetch Result)|====>|MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS.SP_DMS_QUERY_DRIVER (Using Methods Builds Dynamic String)|
(Invokes One Of The Specified Method below. This Builds Actual Dynamic String)) ::==>
1.MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS.SP_DMS_PROD_DOCS |
2.MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS.SP_DMS_ALL_PROD_DOC |
3.MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS.SP_DMS_DOCMNG_DOC |
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________
DEBUG Process:
STEP -1: Use the log file to identify the Parameters used for the instance (Parameters would be "|" delimited)
STEP -2: Using the same Parameter combination execute the Packaged procedure with Server output on
STEP -3: The Packaged procedure would display the Method & Final SQL Used from the procedure
STEP -4: Method is determined in the *DRIVER* method and the base SQL Query is built in corresponding associated procedure
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Builds Result Set For DMS Landing Page using associated methods.
PROCEDURE.COMMENT: Builds Result Set For DMS Landing Page using associated methods.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_LOWER_LIMIT
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Starting number for documents to be fetched; default value 1.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_UPPER_LIMIT
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Total number for documents to be fetched; default value 100.

ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Uses a ref cursor to return a query's records.

P_FLAG Flag.

P_UPPER_LIMIT Total number for documents to be fetched; default value 100.

O_DOC_PARAM_CUR Document parameter output.

PROCEDURE.NAME: SP_DMS_SEARCH
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Builds Result Set For DMS Search Page using associated methods.
PROCEDURE.COMMENT: Builds Result Set For DMS Search Page using associated methods.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_LOV_NAME
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Name of the LOV; default value null.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_SEARCH_ALL_VERSION
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Document search for all version if value is Y; default value N.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_SRCH_ALL_V_DOC_NAME
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Document name used as a flag; default value null.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_ADV_SEARCH_FLAG
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Flag value Y means supports advance search;default value N.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_DOC_STATUS
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Document Status; Values can be Production,Ready for Production,Obsolete,Terminated,In Process; default value null.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_DOC_VERSION
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Version number of the Document; default value null.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_DOC_LAST_UPD_BY
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Document last updated user; default value null.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_DOC_ASSIGNED_TO
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Document assigned to user; default value null.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_DOC_DATE_TYPE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Value can be LAST UPDATED ON or EFFECTIVE FROM; default value null.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_DOC_BEGIN_DATE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Start date for Document search; default value null.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_DOC_END_DATE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: End date for Document search; default value null.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_INCLUDE_SUB_CATG_FLAG
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Flag value Y means catagory/ies are selected; default value null.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_MAIN_CATEGORY
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Parent Category identifier; Default value null.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_SUB_CATEGORY_1
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: First Sub category identifier; Default value null.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_SUB_CATEGORY_2
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Second Sub category identifier; Default value null.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_SUB_CATEGORY_3
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Third Sub category identifier; Default value null.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_SUB_CATEGORY_4
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Fourth Sub category identifier; Default value null.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_IS_DOC_MANAGER
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Flag value Y means the user is Document manager; default value Y.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_LOWER_LIMIT
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Starting number for documents to be fetched; default value 1.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_UPPER_LIMIT
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Total number for documents to be fetched; default value 100.

ARGUMENT.NAME: O_CURSOR
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Uses a ref cursor to return a query's records.

ARGUMENT.NAME: O_DOC_PARAM_CUR
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Uses a ref cursor to return a query's records.

ARGUMENT.COMMENT: List of parameter values printed as output.

P_DOC_LAST_UPD_BY Document last updated user; default value null.
P_DOC_ASSIGNED_TO Document assigned to user; default value null.
P_DOC_DATE_TYPE Value can be LAST UPDATED ON or EFFECTIVE FROM; default value null.
P_DOC_BEGIN_DATE Start date for Document search; default value null.
P_DOC_END_DATE End date for Document search; default value null.
P_DATE_FMT Date format; default value null.
P_INCLUDE_SUB_CATG_FLAG Flag value Y means catagory/ies are selected; default value null.
P_MAIN_CATEGORY Parent Category identifier; Default value null.
P_SUB_CATEGORY_1 First Sub category identifier; Default value null.
P_SUB_CATEGORY_2 Second Sub category identifier; Default value null.
P_SUB_CATEGORY_3 Third Sub category identifier; Default value null.

PROCEDURE.NAME: SP_DMS_QUERY_DRIVER
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Logic driven by the Parameter set to determine the Search Method to be used.
PROCEDURE.COMMENT: Logic driven by the Parameter set to determine the Search Method to be used.

ARGUMENT.NAME: P_ADVANCE_SEARCH_FLAG

PACKAGE.NAME: MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS_ATRB
PACKAGE.COMMENT:
======================================================================
Module: MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS_ATRB
Description: This Package Encapsulates All the modules for Document Search. The search uses the Oracle Text domain Index concept.
======================================================================
____________________________________________________________________________________
PROCEDURE NAME Usage
--------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------------
- SP_DOCUMENT_HOME Result Set For DMS Landing Page.
- SP_DMS_SEARCH Result Set For DMS Search Page.
- SP_DMS_QUERY_DRIVER Logic driven by the Parameter set to determine the Search Method to be used.
- SP_DMS_PROD_DOCS Builds Search Query For Users (No Advance Search).
- SP_DMS_ALL_PROD_DOC Builds Search Query For Users/Admin/Manager (All the Version).
- SP_DMS_DOCMNG_DOC Builds Search Query For Admin/Manager (Advance Search).
- DMS_SEARCH_PLCY Result Set For DMS Policy Page.
- DMS_SEARCH_FAV Result Set For DMS Favourite Page.
- DMS_GET_CAT_SRCH_FLTR This formats CATEGORY input from UI.
- DMS_XTND_ATRB Get all the columns from the table 'MS_DMS_DOC_EXTENDED_ATTRIBS'.
____________________________________________________________________________________

Flow:
1. LANDING_PAGE
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________
|UI(JAVA) |<======> |SP_DOCUMENT_HOME (Fetch Result)| ______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

2. SEARCH_PAGE
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________
|UI(JAVA)|<======> |SP_DMS_SEARCH(Parameter input)(Using methods builds dynamic string/query)|<======>| SP_DMS_QUERY_DRIVER |
(Invokes One Of The Below which builds actual dynamic string/query) )
||
|--------------------------------------|
| SP_DMS_PROD_DOCS |
| OR |
| SP_DMS_ALL_PROD_DOC |
| OR |
| SP_DMS_DOCMNG_DOC |
|--------------------------------------|
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

3. DEBUG Process
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

STEP -0: Log as SYSTEMI-->configuration parameter(Tab): MS APPSTUDIO PARAMETER value is set to 0. STEP -1: The Input Parameters are written into the table MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS_ATRB_lOG.
STEP -2: The Query for specific calls made from UI are written into MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS_ATRB_lOG based on the input given or select on the UI.
STEP -3: Call the Procedure SP_DMS_SEARCH with parameters logged in the table MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS_ATRB_lOG.
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

-- Change History
-- Developer Date Comments
-- --------- -------- ---------------------------------------------
-- Samaresh 1-JUL-2014 Initial Version Search uses OracleText Indexes.
-- Samaresh 12-FEB-2015 Logging will be captured based on configuration parameter MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS_ATRB_lOG value set to 0.

PACKAGE.NAME: MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS_ATRB_33
PACKAGE.COMMENT:
======================================================================
Module: MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS_ATRB
Description: This Package Encapsulates All the modules for Document Search. The search uses the Oracle Text domain Index concept.
======================================================================
____________________________________________________________________________________
PROCEDURE NAME Usage
--------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------------
- SP_DOCUMENT_HOME Result Set For DMS Landing Page.
- SP_DMS_SEARCH Result Set For DMS Search Page.
- SP_DMS_QUERY_DRIVER Logic driven by the Parameter set to determine the Search Method to be used.
- SP_DMS_PROD_DOCS Builds Search Query For Users (No Advance Search).
- SP_DMS_ALL_PROD_DOC Builds Search Query For Users/Admin/Manager (All the Version).
- SP_DMS_DOCMNG_DOC Builds Search Query For Admin/Manager (Advance Search).
- DMS_SEARCH_PLCY Result Set For DMS Policy Page.
- DMS_SEARCH_FAV Result Set For DMS Favourite Page.
- DMS_GET_CAT_SRCH_FLTR This formats CATEGORY input from UI.
- DMS_XTND_ATRB Get all the columns from the table 'MS_DMS_DOC_EXTENDED_ATTRIBS'.
____________________________________________________________________________________

Flow:
1. LANDING_PAGE
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________
|UI(JAVA) |<======> |SP_DOCUMENT_HOME (Fetch Result)| ______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

2. SEARCH_PAGE
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________
|UI(JAVA)|<======> |SP_DMS_SEARCH(Parameter input)(Using methods builds dynamic string/query)|<======>| SP_DMS_QUERY_DRIVER |
(Invokes One Of The Below which builds actual dynamic string/query) )
||
|--------------------------------------|
| SP_DMS_PROD_DOCS |
| OR |
| SP_DMS_ALL_PROD_DOC |
| OR |
| SP_DMS_DOCMNG_DOC |
|--------------------------------------|
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

3. DEBUG Process
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

STEP -0: Log as SYSTEMI-->configuration parameter(Tab): MS APPSTUDIO PARAMETER value is set to 0. STEP -1: The Input Parameters are written into the table MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS_ATRB_lOG.
STEP -2: The Query for specific calls made from UI are written into MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS_ATRB_lOG based on the input given or select on the UI.
STEP -3: Call the Procedure SP_DMS_SEARCH with parameters logged in the table MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS_ATRB_lOG.
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

-- Change History
-- Developer Date Comments
-- --------- -------- ---------------------------------------------
-- Samaresh 1-JUL-2014 Initial Version Search uses OracleText Indexes.
-- Samaresh 12-FEB-2015 Logging will be captured based on configuration parameter MS_DMS_SEARCH_OPS_ATRB_lOG value set to 0.

PACKAGE.NAME: MS_DMS_SEC508_SEARCH_OPT
PACKAGE.COMMENT:
======================================================================
Module: MS_DMS_SEC508_SEARCH_OPT
Description: This Package Encapsulates All the modules for Document Search for 508
======================================================================
Flow:
1. LANDING_PAGE
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________
|JAVA |====>|MS_DMS_SEC508_SEARCH_OPT.SP_DOCUMENT_HOME|====>|MS_DMS_SEC508_SEARCH_OPT.SP_DMS_QUERY_DRIVER|====>
|MS_DMS_SEC508_SEARCH_OPT.SP_DMS_PROD_DOCS(Invokes Specified Method and this Builds Actual Dynamic String)|
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

2. SEARCH_PAGE
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________
|JAVA Calls|====>|MS_DMS_SEC508_SEARCH_OPT.SP_DMS_SEARCH (Uses Dynamic String To Fetch Result)|====>|MS_DMS_SEC508_SEARCH_OPT.SP_DMS_QUERY_DRIVER (Using Methods Builds Dynamic String)|
(Invokes One Of The Specified Method below. This Builds Actual Dynamic String)) ::==>
1.MS_DMS_SEC508_SEARCH_OPT.SP_DMS_PROD_DOCS |
2.MS_DMS_SEC508_SEARCH_OPT.SP_DMS_ALL_PROD_DOC |
3.MS_DMS_SEC508_SEARCH_OPT.SP_DMS_DOCMNG_DOC |
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________
DEBUG Process:
STEP -1: Use the log file to identify the Parameters used for the instance (Parameters would be "|" delimited)
STEP -2: Using the same Parameter combination execute the Packaged procedure with Server output on
STEP -3: The Packaged procedure would display the Method & Final SQL Used from the procedure
STEP -4: Method is determined in the *DRIVER* method and the base SQL Query is built in corresponding associated procedure
______________________________________________________________________________________________________________

===========================================================================

PACKAGE.NAME: MS_DMS_UPDATE_DOCUMENT

======================================================================
Module: MS_DMS_UPDATE_DOCUMENT
Description: Methods in this package are used for insertion of the form data to base tables of the DMS
Method is called for the when document is upversioned or performed change request
Values populated to tables are MS_DMS_DOC_AUDIT_HISTORY, MS_DMS_DOCUMENTS_HDR, MS_DMS_DOCUMENTS etc.
======================================================================

PROCEDURE.NAME: PROCESS_CREATE_DOCUMENT
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE:
PROCESS_CREATE_DOCUMENT method is called when ms dms update document form is submitted
This stored procedure will be called to populate the record in ms_dms_process_doc_hdr, ms_dms_doc_audit_history.
Send the assignment for enable stage user list or ms dms review document push form based on the condition.
PROCEDURE.COMMENT:
PROCESS_CREATE_DOCUMENT method is called when ms dms update document form is submitted
This stored procedure will be called to populate the record in ms_dms_process_doc_hdr, ms_dms_doc_audit_history.
Send the assignment for enable stage user list or ms dms review document push form based on the condition.

ARGUMENT.NAME: X_ERROR_MESSAGE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Error message parameter , in case of exceptions and errors.

TAG.COMMENT: x_process_instance_id process_instance_id of the form submitted.
X_ERROR_CODE 0 for success non-zero for error.
X_ERROR_MESSAGE Error message parameter , in case of exceptions and errors.

PROCEDURE.NAME: PROCESS_DOCUMENT_REVIEW
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE:
PROCESS_DOCUMENT_REVIEW method is called for document review flow.
This method will handle the operations from reviewer stage to Production.
This method in turns calls the sub programs for insertion into DMS base tables.
PROCEDURE.COMMENT:
PROCESS_DOCUMENT_REVIEW method is called for document review flow.
This method will handle the operations from reviewer stage to Production.
This method in turns calls the sub programs for insertion into DMS base tables.

ARGUMENT.NAME: X_CURRENT_LEVEL_NUMBER
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Level number or stage id of the form.

ARGUMENT.NAME: X_CURRENT_USER
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Current logged in user name or form submitted user.

ARGUMENT.NAME: X_MOVE_ACCROSS_LEVELS
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Next stage Level of the form submitted.

ARGUMENT.NAME: X_EMAIL_FLAG
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Flag to determine the email checks.

ARGUMENT.NAME: X_RETURN_LEVEL_NUMBER
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Stage sequence numbe of the submitted form.

ARGUMENT.NAME: X_USER_ACTION_TYPE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Action type choosen by the submitted user.

ARGUMENT.NAME: X_RET_ARGS1
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Out parameter, Document Action type will be value for this.

ARGUMENT.NAME: X_RET_ARGS2
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Out parameter, Level number type will be value for this.

ARGUMENT.NAME: X_ERROR_MESSAGE
ARGUMENT.COMMENT: Error message parameter , in case of exceptions and errors.

TAG.COMMENT: x_process_instance_id Process_instance_id of the form submitted.
x_current_level_number Level number or stage id of the form.
x_current_user Current logged in user name or form submitted user.
x_move_accross_levels Next stage Level of the form submitted.
x_email_flag Flag to determine the email checks.
x_return_level_number Stage sequence numbe of the submitted form.
x_user_action_type Action type choosen by the submitted user.
x_final_stage Last stage of the form.
x_ret_args1 Out parameter, Document Action type will be value for this.
x_ret_args2 Out parameter, Level number type will be value for this.
x_ret_args3 Out parameter, ,Mail User List value.
x_ret_args4 Out parameter, approval requrirement value.
x_ret_args5 Out parameter, temporaray value.
x_ret_args6 Out parameter, Version number value.
x_ret_argsn7 Out parameter, Current stage sequence.
x_ret_argsn8 Out parameter, temporaray value.
x_ret_argsn9 Out parameter, temporaray value.
x_ret_argsn10 Out parameter, temporaray value.
X_ERROR_CODE 0 for success non-zero for error.
X_ERROR_MESSAGE Error message parameter , in case of exceptions and errors.
x_assignment_id Assignment ID of the form.

PROCEDURE.NAME: PROCESS_DOCUMENT_REVIEW
PROCEDURE.COMMENT_FIRST_LINE: Flow Logic: 1.Get all the push form infolet ids 2.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_hdr table Here it is checking whether the document submition is valid or not.
PROCEDURE.COMMENT:
Flow Logic: 1.Get all the push form infolet ids 2.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_hdr table Here it is checking whether the document submition is valid or not. if not it will exit the program 3.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_stage_dtl table 4.Get the record from ms_dms_documents_stage_usr_dtl table 5.Get the record from the DMS Review push form. 6.update all Common attributes like a.document_attachment b.comments_log sub procedure used : update_common_attributes 7.if the document owner is doing a continue working 1.He may lock and unlock the document while doing continue working sub procedure used: process_continue_working 8.if one of the user is submiting the form (Moving to next level) then 1.current_process_status in ms_dms_documents_stage_usr_dtl set to 'Y' 2.check type of approval required to move the stage 3.version number generation for each submit 4.update the latest version number in ms_dms_documents_hdr table (get the latest from ms_dms_documents_hdr table) 5.Check whether Creating new assignments for the new stage depend on the approval type 6.If it is yes then delete any existing assignments for DMS Review form. 7.create assignments for new stages 8.update the ms_dms_documents_hdr table for the following columns a.current_stage_seq b.current_stage_id c.current_stage_name d.version_number
Approval Process can be All Any Owner Non Owner - Any Non Owner - All
sub procedure used : process_doc_move_stage 9.if user is set to prev level then 1.Calculate the previous seq number 2.Create all assingnments for the previous level 3.Update the ms_dms_documents_hdr for following columns a.current_stage_seq b.current_stage_id c.current_stage_name d.version_number 4.update the ms_dms_documents_stage_dtl table for current_stage_flag set to 'Y' for current level 5.update the ms_dms_documents_stage_usr_dtl table for current_process_status set to 'Y' for current level users and update all the assignments. sub procedure used : process_doc_move_stage
10.if the user terminate the document process then
